ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a seamless and integrated native mobile and desktop experience for users to control their Home Assistant smart home setup on Apple devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Native iOS, iPadOS, and macOS applications for Home Assistant â€¢ Control and monitor smart home devices â€¢ Manage automations and scenes â€¢ View sensor data and device states
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides the official Home Assistant client application for Apple platforms, allowing users to control and monitor their smart home devices from their iPhones, iPads, and Macs. It offers a native experience for managing automations, viewing sensor data, and interacting with various smart home integrations.

ðŸš€ win-vind | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To enable users, particularly those familiar with Vim, to control and interact with the Windows graphical user interface using keyboard shortcuts and Vim-like commands, thereby increasing efficiency and productivity.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Vim-like UI operation for Windows GUI â€¢ Vim configuration methods and mode concepts â€¢ Built-in commands for UI operations â€¢ User-defined commands by combining built-in commands
ðŸ“– Summary: win-vind is a C++ tool that provides a Vim-like user interface for controlling Windows. It allows users to operate the Windows GUI using Vim's familiar key bindings and mode concepts, offering a lightweight and portable solution for enhanced productivity.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ mail2telegram | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To receive and manage emails through a Telegram bot, effectively creating a temporary, accessible inbox anywhere via Telegram.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Forward emails to Telegram messages â€¢ Cloudflare Email Routing integration â€¢ Serverless deployment with Cloudflare Workers â€¢ Temporary mailbox with infinite address â€¢ Webhook binding for Telegram Bot API
ðŸ“– Summary: mail2telegram is a serverless application that forwards emails received via Cloudflare Email Routing to a Telegram bot. It creates a temporary mailbox for any email prefix, converting incoming emails into Telegram messages for easy access and management.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ KeyForge3D | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Generating 3D printable STL files of keys from photographs for replication.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Key Shape Extraction from photo â€¢ Bitting Analysis and code detection â€¢ 3D Model Generation â€¢ STL Export â€¢ User-Friendly GUI
ðŸ“– Summary: KeyForge3D is a Python application that converts a photograph of a physical key into a 3D-printable STL file. It uses image processing to analyze the key's bitting pattern and generates an accurate 3D model, making it useful for locksmiths and hobbyists for quick key replication.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ collab-dev | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Analyzing collaboration metrics and insights from GitHub code review data to improve team efficiency and understanding of development workflows.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Fetches pull request data from GitHub repositories â€¢ Generates interactive charts using Plotly â€¢ Provides a Command Line Interface for analysis â€¢ Uses portable and minimal CSV data structure â€¢ Extensible for adding new custom charts
ðŸ“– Summary: collab-dev is an open-source Python tool that analyzes GitHub pull request data to generate collaboration metrics and visualizations. It helps teams understand their code review workflow, process efficiency, and overall collaboration patterns.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ pycm | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Evaluating the performance of multi-class classification models in machine learning.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-class confusion matrix generation â€¢ Supports input data vectors and direct matrices â€¢ Comprehensive overall and class-specific statistics â€¢ Plotting capabilities for confusion matrices â€¢ Compatibility with various Python versions and ML frameworks
ðŸ“– Summary: PyCM is a Python library for generating and evaluating multi-class confusion matrices. It supports various input formats and provides a comprehensive set of statistical metrics for post-classification model assessment, making it a versatile tool for data scientists.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
